data.title: 19 things you probably didn't know about Taylor Swift
data.meta_description: The number 13 is Taylor Swift's favourite number, but why? We explain all and look at 19 facts that you probably didn't know about the pop star.
data.text:
She's so talented!

Taylor Swift is a multi-award winning and history-making artist, having 14 Grammys, two BRIT Awards, including the Global Icon award, and plenty more. Now with 11 albums under her belt, the singer is currently on her epic 'Eras Tour' - which has arrived in the UK, and inspired a university to hold a one-day event about Taylor. So, it's fair to say there's a LOT to get to know about the singer.

Here we take a look at the incredibly talented and universally beloved pop star Taylor Swift, with 19 things that you probably didn't know about her - from why 13 is her lucky number, to who her cats Olivia and Meredith are named after...

1) What are Taylor Swift's cats called?

Taylor has three cats. Two of the cats are named after famous TV characters. The cats, Meredith and Olivia, are named after Ellen Pompeo's character in Grey's Anatomy, whilst Olivia gets her name from Mariska Hargitay's character in Law & Order: Special Victims.

Taylor's third and newest cat is called Benjamin Button, after Brad Pitt's character in the film of the same name. Taylor met Benjamin on the set of the music video for ME!, a song she duetted on with Panic! at the Disco's Brendon Urie.

2) Does Taylor Swift write her own songs?

Taylor Swift has written or co-written nearly every song that she has released, and Taylor's had a lot of songs! To date she has had 11 albums, plus four re-recordings and over 61 singles as the lead artist!

3) How old was she when she wrote her first song?

Taylor wrote her first song when she was just 12-years-old, it was called 'Lucky You'.

4) How old was Taylor when she got signed?

When Taylor Swift was 14-years-old she was signed to Sony/ATV music publishing, making her the youngest songwriter EVER to be hired by them.

5) Can Taylor Swift play the guitar?

Yes, Taylor Swift can play the guitar. She reportedly learnt how to play a 12-string guitar BEFORE she learnt the 'usual' six-string guitar.

6) Who has Taylor Swift collaborated with?

Taylor has been part of quite a few collaborations over the years, with the likes of Kendrick Lamar, Ed Sheeran and former One Direction member Zayn Malik - plus many more.

7) Has Taylor Swift ever performed on Broadway?

Taylor auditioned for Broadway shows when she was younger, but never made it onto the stage. However, in 2019 she appeared in the film version of Andrew Lloyd Webber's Cats as Bombalurina.

8) Why is the song 'Love Story' so special?

Taylor Swift's 2008 song 'Love Story' became the first song ever to reach Number 1 in both the pop and country music charts in the US.

WATCH: Taylor Swift - 'Love Story'

9) Has she broken any records?

When Taylor's sixth album, 'reputation' was released in 2017, she became the only artist to release four consecutive albums which sold more than one million copies in their first week of release. On top of that, in 2024, she made history as the first artist to win the Grammy Award for Album of the Year four times.

In July 2023, Taylor's song 'Anti-Hero' surpassed a billion streams on Spotify. Taylor also has three other tracks in the Billions Club - 'Shake It Off', 'Blank Space' and her collab with Zayn Malik, 'I Don't Wanna Live Forever'.

'Anti-Hero' also became the first track from Taylor's album 'Midnights' to receive a BPI certification of 3x Platinum - meaning that its seen over 1.8 MILLION sales in the UK. Not bad going!

Taylor also broke numerous records and made history with her incredible 'Eras Tour' - which you can check out here.

10) What is Taylor Swift's pseudonym?

Taylor normally writes under her own name, but once she used the pseudonym Nils SjÃ¶berg on Calvin Harris' song 'This Is What You Came For' featuring Rihanna . At the time, Calvin and Taylor were dating and it's believed that they didn't want their names to overshadow the song's release.

11) Do Taylor Swift's relationships inspire her songs?

Taylor's ex-boyfriends have been the subject of a number of songs including, her relationship with One Direction singer Harry Styles. She reportedly wrote 'I Knew You Were Trouble' about their relationship.

WATCH: Taylor Swift - 'I Knew You Were Trouble' (Official Video)

12) Hidden messages in her songs and music videos

Taylor often has hidden messages in her music videos, in her video for 'Delicate' fans noticed lot of hidden messages . You can also see all the hidden messages from the 'Look What You Made Me Do' video.

13) Why is the number 13 lucky for Taylor Swift?

Whilst it might be unlucky for many, for Taylor the number 13 is lucky for a number of reasons. In 2009 she told MTV: "I was born on the 13th. I turned 13 on Friday the 13th. My first album went gold in 13 weeks. My first Number 1 song had a 13-second intro. Every time I've won an award I've been seated in either the 13th seat, the 13th row, the 13th section or row M, which is the 13th letter."

14) Taylor's friendship with Blake Lively

Taylor has many celebrity friends and has been close with Blake Lively and her husband Ryan Reynolds since 2015. Taylor has written songs about Ryan and Blake's four daughters, even revealing the name of their third child in a song called 'Betty' on her 2020 'Folklore' album.

Taylor and Blake later worked together when they collaborated on Taylor's 'Red (Taylor's Version)' album.

15) Taylor Swift's 'I Bet You Think About Me (Taylor's Version)' music video

Speaking of her friendship with Blake... Taylor's music video for her re-recorded track 'I Bet You Think About Me (Taylor's Version)' was actually directed by her famous friend!

The video premiered on 15th November 2021, with Taylor sharing a clip to her Instagram along with the caption: 'The reddest video EVER is out now. Directed by @blakelively who SMASHED it just like I smashed this cake.'

16) Which song did she perform on SNL?

As part of her 'Red (Taylor's Version)' album, Taylor released a 10-minute version of her song 'All Too Well' which she created for the short film All Too Well: A Short Film, also released starring Sadie Sink and Dylan Oâ€™Brien.

Taylor performed the song for the first time live when she performed on Saturday Night Live on 13th November.

17) Taylor Swift was 12,000 days old when her album 'Midnights' came out

We all know how Taylor loves to include Easter Eggs in her music releases, and it seems like the release time of 'Midnights' was significant.

Taylor brought out the album at midnight on 21st October 2022, which seemed like a fitting time given the name. But fans on Twitter figured out there was a deeper significance, as Taylor was exactly 12,000 days old at the time of release, which is symbolic of the number 12 and midnight!

18) Taylor has written a film script

We all know that Taylor is a hugely creative person, and can seemingly turn her hand to pretty much any aspect of showbiz at this point. While she's acted in films before, and of course, is fantastic at telling stories, she's never put the two together until now.

Announced in December 2022, Taylor has penned a film script which is being put into production by Searchlight Pictures! Presidents of the company David Greenbaum and Matthew Greenfield said: "Taylor is a once in a generation artist and storyteller. It is a genuine joy and privilege to collaborate with her as she embarks on this exciting and new creative journey."

19) Taylor made MTV Video Music Awards history

In September 2023, Taylor made VMAs history by becoming the first person to win the Video of the Year award an incredible four times. Taylor won the award for her song 'Anti-Hero', having previously scooped the accolade for 'All Too Well: The Short Film', 'Bad Blood' and 'You Need To Calm Down'.

In total, Taylor won an astonishing nine awards at the 2023 VMAs, scooping a gong in every category she was nominated in.
